page.title: 11Darvell Hall-History
page.content: Darvell Hall lies about 2miles from the centre of Robertsbridge.The existing building dates from 1722 and served as the Manor House;although it may actually be as old as 1590.It has been extended over the years and was utilised for health purposes as a T.B. Sanatorium in the 1920's.The Hall was purchased 1n 1971 by the Hutterian Society of Brothers,an Anabaptist Community of German origin.They have added considerably to the buildings,including facilities for housing,recreation and most of their needs.The site has an area of about 200acres including a small farming element,which is used mainly by the Communities children.There is a swimming pool,factory and a large communal dining hall.Most of the new buildings are built in a style which blends with the old.
